alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun, northeastern Barnwell, Lexington, Aiken, northwestern Orangeburg and south central Richland Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Red Bank to Aiken Mall. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Aiken, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Batesburg-Leesville, Aiken Mall, Oak Grove, McEntire Air Base, Red Bank, Williston, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, SC State Fair Grounds, Citizens Park, Hopkins, USC Aiken, SC State Farmer`s Market, and Columbia Metro Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 9 and 60. Interstate 26 between mile markers 110 and 129. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
